paper_metadata.title: Genetic, clinic and histopathologic characterization of BRCA-associated hereditary breast and ovarian cancer in southwestern Finland
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the BRCA2 gene along with penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 43.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with ovarian cancer at age 49.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to a frameshift and is associated with a significant increase in cancer risk.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is a founder mutation in Finland.
key_quotes: 27% southwestern BRCA2-families have a unique PV.
The BRCA PV (9%) increases the risk for same patient having both ovarian and breast cancer.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 59.

functional_data.summary: The variant affects splicing and is associated with increased cancer risk.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family studies.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is a founder mutation in Finland.
key_quotes: 39% of BRCA1-families have a unique PV.
The risk ratio for bilateral breast cancer is approximately four times when compared BRCA2.

tables_processed.table_caption: Most common and founder BRCA1 and BRCA2 pathogenic variants in southwestern Finland and their appearance in other countries.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
